summary: This is an email from July 26, 2019, regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein's medication. It notes a discrepancy in the amount of Colace and milk of magnesia he was given to self-carry (15 days' worth and half a bottle) versus what was expected (30 days' worth and a full bottle).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email, an inmate whose medication (Colace and milk of magnesia) is being discussed in terms of the quantity provided for self-carry.

events.title: Medication Discrepancy for Inmate Epstein
events.description: An email is sent noting that inmate Jeffrey Epstein is being given 15 days' worth of Colace and half a bottle of milk of magnesia to self-carry, instead of the expected 30 days' worth and a full bottle.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated July 26, 2019, concerning inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
It details a specific discrepancy in the quantity of medication (Colace and milk of magnesia) provided to Epstein for self-carry in jail.
The email is marked as 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) document set related to the Epstein case.
